Bum-Ayush, like every mother, loves her children, so she is planning to thicken her house walls, using materials such as cement, bricks, and glass-wool insulation, in order to stop the heat loss through the walls. So, Bum-Ayush is requesting 5,000,000 MNT to thicken her house walls.

loans.use: to thicken the walls of her house, using materials such as cement, brick, and glass-wool insulation, in order to lower the family's consumption of coal.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel, a businessman from Kongowea, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. He owns a retail shop trading in water cans and basins, as well as assorted sets of dinning plates, cups and cooking items. His business has been in operation for one year; he also has other employment. Daniel faces the challenge of a lack of funds to grow his business. He is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock to sell at his store. He believes the extra income will help him meet his family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy water cans, basins, sets of dinning plates, cups and cooking items.

loans.name: Lodi

texts.en:
Lodi is a 33-year-old father of two young children, 3 and 1 years old, who lives with his family in the very rural north of Albania. He is the only financial provider for the family and the caretaker for his elderly parents. He is busy every day, all day long, and this lifestyle keeps him content, he explained.
Lodi has a livestock business, including animals like cows, goats and sheep, and he has a large clientele throughout his region and central Albania. He sells milk to dairy farms and also baby animals to the local market. 
The loan of 300,000 Albanian Lek that Lodi is requesting from VFA is to build a stable for his goats.  He has separated the animals and already build separate stables for the cows and sheep, and now he wants to do the same for the goats.
His goal is to employ others as he expands his business, and this will happen soon, Lodi says.

loans.use: to build a goat stable.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a person who is known for being calm, cheerful and a hard worker. She has tremendous drive to succeed. Asia is single and lives in a rental house.
She puts great effort into her work. She needs to invest in her business, so that she can grow her clientele and generate more income. 
The loan she is requesting from Yehu will be invested in the purchase of combs, brushes, hair dryers, hair dyes and nail polishes that she lacks, in order to provide good service to her customers. Asia dreams of having a larger salon and assistants who can provide service to more people. As a result, she will be able to help herself move forward.

loans.use: to purchase combs, brushes, hair dryers, hair dyes and nail polishes for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Tinga

texts.en: Tinga is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He runs a grocery stall selling fruits and vegetables, and is also employed as a mechanic. Tinga was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. His main challenge is recovering the debts accrued by some customers who receive his goods on credit. His difficulties notwithstanding, Tinga looks forward to opening other branches of his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a resident of Mariakani, in Coast province, Kenya. She is a married mother of two and runs a dress-making shop, a business that she has been operating for two years. She learned about Milango through an employee, and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of her business. Her main challenge is customers not paying on time. Mwanajuma is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenyan shillings to purchase clothes and sewing items like thread and buttons. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her standard of living. She aspires to open a larger dress-making shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and sewing items like thread and buttons.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.en:
Florentino has always stood out in his community as an innovator, always ready to implement new technologies to improve his harvest

His purchase of a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester fits that trend. He plans to use the system to process his animal manure into potent organic fertilizer for his maize, oatmeal, squash, and beans, turning waste into a valuable resource. Additionally, Florentino’s family will benefit from the biogas generated by his system in the kitchen and in the bathroom, displacing the expensive and non-renewable LP gas they currently use to cook meals and heat bathwater. 

This Kiva loan represents 51%  of the total cost of their Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 41 years old and married.

Adela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Adela has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years, and she also earns an income from raising pigs.

Adela aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Quenie

texts.en:
Quenie is 31 years old and married. She has three children, who are in school.

Quenie is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Quenie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Quenie has been raising pigs for five years now.  She has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Quenie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar, esta realizando una nueva siembra de granos basicos, necesita capital para invertirlo en la siembra, por ello está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para la compra de sacos de 10 abono y pagar mano de obra; así poder tener una mejor siembra y mejorar su estado económico.
El nos comenta que gracias al crédito anterior tubo mayor capacidad de inversión y aumentar sus ingresos por la cosecha, el sigue con sosteniendo a su familia gracias a los prestamos de Kiva.
texts.en:
Oscar is growing a new crop of basic grains, so he needs capital to invest in planting. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy 10 sacks of compost and pay for labor. This will enable him to have a better planting season and improve his financial situation.

Oscar says that his previous loan gave him more investment capacity, so he was able to gain more income from his harvest. He continues to support his family with the help of the loans from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of compost and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a resident of the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married. He owns a second-hand clothes shop, a business that he has been operating for six years. Jonathan learned about Milango through an employee and joined the company with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of his business. His main challenges are some customers not paying on time and the seasonal business climate. Jonathan is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase bales of second-hand clothes and shoes. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Jose Edilberto

texts.es:
José, necesita inversión en su cultivo de maíz y de frijol, ya que realiza una nueva siembra, es por ello que está nuevamente solicitando un crédito que le ayudara en la compra de cuatro sacos de abono, como complemento para cultivar el maíz y el frijol.
El comenta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a la compra de fertilizantes e insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, así pudo mejorar la cosecha y también sus ingresos económicos, la estabilidad económica de su familia depende de los buenos resultados del cultivo.
texts.en:
José needs to invest in his corn and bean crops, since he's sowing again. That's the reason why he's requesting a new loan, which will help him to purchase four sacks of fertilizer as an addition in order to grow corn and beans.
He reports that the previous loan helped him to buy fertilizer and farming supplies for his corn and bean crops. That way he could improve the harvest and also his financial income. His family's financial stability depends on the good results he gets from his crop.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida, 27, is a married mother of two children. She started her own home-based business 2 years ago selling assorted home products like cookies, packaged snacks, flour, sugar, soft drinks, etc. She is requesting a loan that will be used to buy more stock. She wants her business to stay well-supplied to increase profits. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, flour, rice, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid, who is a businessman living in Malindi, benefited greatly from the last loan he received. He bought charger components, rolls of aerial cables and assorted electrical cables. He is single and his business has been running for three years. He is also employed as a clerk. Rashid is now applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of mobile phones, chargers, bulbs and torches. He believes the extra income will help him save enough to start a family next year.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of mobile phones, chargers, bulbs and torches.

loans.name: Kamadev

texts.en:
Kamadev owns and manages a variety store where he sells betel, coconut, incense sticks, biscuits, butter, tobacco sachets; garlands (used for worshipping god) etc. He established his shop in the village 4 years ago.

He is a 36-year-old, 'differently-able' person living with his wife and two sons aged 7 and 9 years old in a small village of Odisha, India. As he was not able to do any kind of work in which physical strength is required, he started a variety shop in the nearby market close to his village.

He has requested a loan amount of 25,000 INR for purchasing more stock of what he sells and a few new products like electric bulbs, detergents, soap, noodles, oil, etc., for his shop. 

He has a dream: to have his children study in a good school and save some money to make their future secure.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing betel, coconut, incense sticks, biscuits, butter, detergents, soap, and noodles for his variety shop.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro and his family are struggling maize farmers in the high plains of Tlaxcala, Mexico.  They do not have irrigation and only plant when the rains permit. The high cost of agrochemical fertilizer has forced them to limit how much they can farm.  With a new six cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, they will no longer have to worry about ever-increasing fertilizer costs, as they will be able to produce their own organic fertilizer using the waste from their sheep.  Additionally, Pedro’s family plans to use their new source of renewable energy to cook and heat bathwater. This Kiva loan represents 49% of the total cost of his system.

loans.use: purchase a biodigester to make his own fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a broom-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

NWTF is re-listing Marian's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her broom-making business

loans.name: Mahendra Ku

texts.en:
Mahendra is a 43-year-old 'differently-able' person living with his wife and three children who are in school. He owns and manages a tailoring shop in his house. As he was not able to do any kind of work in which more physical strength is required, he started a tailoring shop in his house seven years back.
 
He has a plan to enhance his business by adding new sewing machines to his shop, so that he can take more orders from his customers and complete their orders on time. This will help him increase his customer base and monthly income.

Mahendra has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR for purchasing sewing machines and fabrics for his shop. He also wants to appoint a work force for his assistance. He says that he wants to send his children to a good school and give them all the necessities of life.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing sewing machines and fabrics for his tailoring shop.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny es una señora esforzada. Ella necesita de un prestamo de un millon de colones (₡1.000.000) para comprar materiales para poder terminar de construir la casa.
Con el prestamo Jenny espera poder darle una mejor calidad de vida su familia y a sus hijos. por lo que este prestamo va a tener gran importancia para ella.
texts.en:
Jenny is a hard-working woman. She needs a loan of one million colones (₡1,000,000) to purchase materials in order to finish building her home.
With this loan, Jenny hopes to be able to give her family and her children a better quality of life. This loan will have great meaning for her.

loans.use: to buy materials in order to finish her home.

loans.name: Judhisthir

texts.en:
Judhisthir owns and manages a mobile phone repairing and selling centre; he repairs and sells mobile phones in his shop. He has been doing this work for the past 7 years in the market which is 4 kilometres away from his home. 

He is a 30-year-old 'differently-able' person living with his parents, wife and a daughter aged one and a half  in a small village of Odisha, India. He has a plan to expand his business by adding more spare parts like keypads, batteries, memory cards, chips, etc. used in mobile phones and a laptop for downloading songs and uploading them onto memory cards. In villages people don’t have computers to upload songs and pictures in their mobile phones, so they go to the mobile shops to fill up their memory card.

He says that there is no other shop in the village doing the downloading work so if he starts that work that will attract a maximum number of customers and will help him to increase his income.

He has requested a loan amount of 50,000 INR for purchasing spare parts and a laptop for his shop. He has a dream: to give all possible necessities to his family and save some money for his daughter’s education.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing mobile phone spare parts and a laptop for his shop

loans.name: Chaturbhuja

texts.en:
Chaturbhuja is a 30-year-old 'differently-able' person living with his mother and a younger brother aged 28 years in a small village of Odisha, India. He runs a mobile phone repair shop in the market which is 500 meters away from his house. He has 4 years’ experience in this business. 

He has a plan to expand his business by adding more spare parts like keypads, mobile accessories, panels, etc., and to make a showcase for his shop to display the goods. He says that doing so will help him increase his income and attract more customers.

Chaturbhuja has requested a loan amount of 40,000 INR for purchasing spare parts for mobile phones and to make a showcase for his shop. He wants to give his family a good living standard and save money for his future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing spare parts for mobile phones and for making a showcase for his shop.

loans.name: Melcris

texts.en:
Melcris is a 23-year-old mother of a 2-year-old child. She is from the community of Trinidad, Bohol. She currently runs a hog-raising business. She works hard in her business, hoping that it will help her sustain and meet her family's financial needs for daily living. 

Presently, Melcris needs additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy an additional piglet and hog feed. She is certain that through this loan she can buy what she needs to grow and develop her business. 

Melcris is looking for a better future for her business and she hopes that one day it will expand into a higher-yielding investment. With the income from the business, she can provide a better future for her child and put some money aside for future use.

loans.use: to buy feed and a piglet.

loans.name: Johnatan

texts.es: Johnatan, de 27 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su mamá Elena en su casa propia desde que nació. Él es un joven con aspiraciones, hace poco terminó la carrera técnica de agronomía. Desde ese entonces son 4 años de experiencia sembrando maíz, de calidad en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, que le fueron heredados de parte de sus madre, a quien quiere mucho. Gracias a su conocimiento logró adquirir buenos ingresos, ahora desea ampliar sus conocimientos con una carrera universitario, eso es su objetivo. Para ello formó una empresa de carpintería y construcción de obras de infraestructura para el sector público y privado. Gana muy bien en estas actividades, por eso está pensando contratar a profesionales para ampliar sus ganancias y tener más clientes. Pero sin descuidar lo que más le gusta, la agricultura. Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, en todo este tiempo demostró ser puntual y responsable sobre todo gusta de pertenecer a su asociación que lo conforman personas solidarias y con espíritu emprendedor. Johnatan, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en: 27-year-old Johnatan is a responsible man. Ever since he was born, he has lived with his mother Elena in a house she owns. He's a driven young man who recently completed his studies for a technical career in agronomy. Ever since then he has gotten four years' worth of experience in growing high quality corn on his own plots of land. He inherited these plots from his mother, whom he loves very much. Thanks to his knowledge he succeeded in earning good profits, and now he wishes to expand his knowledge through a college education, which is his goal. For that purpose he started a business providing carpentry and infrastructure building services for the public and private sectors. He earns very good profits in this business, and for that reason he's considering hiring professionals in order to increase his earnings and get more customers. However, he doesn't neglect what he loves most, which is agriculture. This is his third loan with MFP. This entire time he has proven to be punctual and responsible, and above all he enjoys being a member of his communal bank which is comprised of supportive people with an enterprising spirit. Johnatan will use the money he requested to purchase organic compost to spread amidst his field.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost to spread amidst his field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair a pigpen and raise hogs.

loans.name: Simiona

texts.es:
Simiona, de 46 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de sus 5 hijos, en la casa que heredó desde hace 15 años. Como mujer del campo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, siembra en sus terrenos agrícolas propios, los cuales quedan a una hora de caminata, los cuales vende en la ciudad de Jauja en cada cosecha. Asimismo se dedica a la crianza de gallinas, cuyes y vacas, los cuales vende con frecuencia, “con la crianza de mis animales obtengo ingresos semanales, eso me ayuda a solventar algunos gastos”, comenta. Como Simiona es una mujer trabajadora, también se dedica a la venta de dulces y comida en las fiestas patronales de algunos pueblos, donde obtiene buenos ingresos adicionales.  Este es el crédito número3 con MFP, en todo este tiempo demostró ser puntual y responsable sobre todo gusta de pertenecer a su asociación “virgen del rosario”,  que lo conforman personas solidarias y con espíritu emprendedor.
Simiona, invertirá el dinero en la compra de gallinas por cantidad, comida balanceada y bebederos de agua para sus animales.
texts.en:
Simiona, age 46, is a happy woman. She lives with her five children in a home which she inherited 15 years ago. As a farmer, she works with agriculture and livestock. She plants on her own agricultural lands, which take her an hour to get to by foot. After every harvest, she sells her produce in the city of Jauja. She also raises hens, guinea pigs, and cows, which she often sells. "Through raising my animals I make a weekly income. This helps me to cover some costs," she says. Since Simiona is a hard-working woman, she also sells sweets and food on the patron saints' days in certain villages; this makes her an additional income. This is her third loan with MFP. All this time, she has proven herself to be punctual, responsible, and above all happy to be part of her group, "Virgen de Rosario". The group is made up of united people with enterprising spirits.
Simona will invest this loan in the purchase of a large quantity of hens, as well as balanced feed and water dispensers for her animals.

loans.use: to buy a large number of hens, as well as balanced feed and water dispensers for her animals.

loans.name: Sanjulata

texts.en:
Sanjulata is a 46-year-old widowed lady living with her son aged 16 and a daughter aged 15 years. She runs a snack stall in the market which is 300 metres away from her house. She has years of experience in this activity. Her husband died 9 years back of a heart attack. After his death all burdens of the family came on Sanjulata. 

She sells snacks items like 'samosa' (fried dough stuffed with potato curry), 'Idli' (a popular recipe of south Indian origin made by steaming a batter consisting of fermented black lentils and rice), 'Wada' (a lentil doughnut)   etc. in her shop.

Sanjulata wants to expand her business by selling more of the items she sells now and to make a showcase for her shop to display the products she cooks. She says that doing so will attract more customers to her shop.

She has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR for purchasing raw materials like potatoes, spices, edible oil, lentils, rice, etc., and for making a showcase for her shop. She has a dream: to have her children study in a good school and save some money for their future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing raw materials like potatoes, spices, edible oil, lentils, rice, etc., for her snack shop and to make a showcase for the shop.

loans.name: Banshidhara

texts.en:
Bansidhara is a 42-year-old 'differently-able' person living with his wife, son aged 14 years and a daughter aged 12 years, in a village of Odisha, India. He own and manages a variety store where he sells coconuts, bananas, biscuits, detergent, soaps, biscuits, incense sticks, etc. He brings products for selling from the nearby market and earns 7,000 INR per month. 

He has a plan to increase his business adding more stock of what he sells and some more variety of products like wafers, toothpaste, toothbrushes, talcum powder, chocolates, potatoes, onions, etc. He says that this will help him to increase his monthly income.

Bansidhara has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR for purchasing more stock of the items he has and some more variety as mentioned above. He wants to make his children well-educated and save money for their bright future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing wafers, toothpaste, toothbrushes, talcum powder, chocolates, potatoes, onions, etc., for his variety shop.

loans.name: Rogaciano

texts.en:
Rogaciano is 42 years old, and he is a resident of Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with five children ages 2 to 11. Rogaciano uses his motorcycle to earn an income for his family. He transports passengers with his 'habal-habal' (a motorcycle used to transport passengers in remote places). 

Rogaciano has been in this business for quite some time now. He is asking for a loan to register his motorcycle and renew his license to operate. In the future, he is determined to send his children to school so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to register his motorcycle and renew his license to operate it

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha's Group is made up of a mother and her daughter but living in separate areas. They sell maize (corn) and Pampers. Martha is 27 years old and her mother is 49 years and they are in their 3rd loan cycle. They are very good and purposeful clients.They have been with ID-Ghana, Kiva's partner, for 3 years.

Martha sells maize (corn) and Pampers at her residence. She lives there together with her husband and son. She will need 1000 Ghana cedis to be able to buy two big bags of maize. Her customers made this order of two bags of maize (corn).

She sells from morning to evening and buys her goods from the maize market and has been reinvesting profit from sales.

They need a total amount of 2000 Ghana cedis to be able to sustain their businesses.

loans.use: To buy two big bags of maize  to supply to customers.

loans.name: Odbayar

texts.en:
Mr Odbayar is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife, Pagma, is 29 years old and an interior designer. His two sons, Enhtemujin and Enhtemulen, are 3 and 1. They go to kindergarten.

Mr.Odbayar started a taxi service business in 2010. He had been transporting people and goods from west border to province center with mini-bus in 2011. He had sold his mini-bus and continued providing taxi service within his car which consumes lot of petrol compared to other cars. He is planning to buy a new Eco-friendly car in order to decrease oil consumption and increase efficiency. He is requesting 2,100,000 MNT to purchase an Eco-friendly vehicle, either a hybrid or electric car for his business. He is clever, hardworking and a well-behaved person.

loans.use: To purchase an Eco-friendly vehicle, either a hybrid or electric car for his business

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en: Magnolia is a 44-year-old woman from the community of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with four children ages 5-19. Magnolia is engaged in buying and selling coconut wine and the key duplication business. She is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wine, 5-gallon containers and blank keys. She is optimistic that the loan will help so she can boost her business for her family. She dreams of seeing her children become successful someday through education.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine, 5-gallon containers and  blank keys

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and one goes to school. She takes care of additional family members (her elderly parents). She operates a pub at the market on a retail basis. She sells her products retail. She has been in business for the last two years and she works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a jerrycan of local brew, crates of beer, soda and other soft drinks.

Florence's major business challenges are defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business into a fully stocked pub. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a jerrycan of local brew, crates of beer, sodas and other soft drinks

loans.name: Ana Bell

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus 6 hijos, lastimosamente por diversas razones desde hace varios años se separó de su esposo, desde entonces ella dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar no pudo estudiar la carrera de Secretariado que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver noticieros y programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Patasca para compartir con su familia. 
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ana puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de  comida, ella vende desayunos, sandwichs, refrescos y otros; todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón, dedicación y por el trato amble que brinda a sus clientes.
Ana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de insumos, tales como harina, azúcar, papas, bebidas, empaques, servicios descartables, entre otros; de esta manera Ana contará con los insumos necesarios para poder seguir trabajando, así ella espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio y construir su casa, para así poder brindar mayor bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a 45 year old woman. She lives in the city of Ica in the district of Santiago with her 6 children. Unfortunately, for various reasons, she has been separated from her husband for some years. Since then, she has put all her effort into bringing up her family. She is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and because she needed to work, she was not able to take the Secretariat course that she wanted to, but she would very much liked to have done so. In her free time, she likes to watch the news and educational programs on tv and sometimes she cooks a delicious patasca stew to share with her family. 
With much persistence and dedication, Ana was able to start her small business selling food. She sells breakfast, sandwiches, sodas, and other things. Every day, she starts work in the early hours of the morning and works for about 10 hours and believes that things are going well due to her good flavors, dedication, and the kind treatment that she offers to her customers.
Ana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help they have offered, she will be able to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, potatoes, drinks, packaging, and disposable table wares. In this way, Ana will secure the supplies that she needs to continue working and she hopes to increase her sales and grow her income. This will help her a lot so that, in the not too distant future, she can grow her business and build her house and so offer a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, potatoes, drinks, packaging,  azúcar, papas, bebidas, empaques, disposable table ware,etc.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is a young entrepreneur from Yerevan. Two years ago, he started his business of furniture making. In order to improve the quality of furniture and make more furniture, Tigran needs to make some investments. With the help of this loan, he plans to purchase new equipment for furniture making. 

Tigran lives with his parents and wife. Tigran dreams of having children and ensuring a prosperous life for them. Development of his business will permit him to make this dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for equipment for furniture making.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 36-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with two young children. Her husband is a heavy-equipment-operator. She has run hog-raising business for two years. She works hard on her business to make it profitable. She is asking for a loan to buy rice for her family's consumption and as feed for her hogs. She plans to make her hog business grow so that she can save enough to invest in another business someday.

loans.use: to buy rice and feed

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 24-year-old man. He is single. He is a student and lives in Sana`a,Yemen. He is requesting a youth loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to help him cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve his living conditions. Taking this loan will allow him comfortable furniture so he can enjoy living in his house.

loans.use: to help him cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve living conditions in his house.

loans.name: Marlynda

texts.en: Marlynda is 46 years old and is a married woman with 3 children ages 10, 15 and 19. Marlynda has a business making roofing out of nipa leaves for almost 2 decades now. Her husband works as a farmer and sometimes help her too. Marlynda is requesting a loan to buy more materials such as nipa leaves and rattan palm.  Marlynda hopes to have other business options so she can provide a quality life for her family. She is from Trinidad, Bohol.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves, rattan palm, fertilizer and  rice

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has buys and sells rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for business.

Prescila has been in this business for 10 years. Prescila earns additional income from fishing.

Prescila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Alejandra works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns an additional income from raising pigs.  Alejandra is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Alejandra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 62 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Anita has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, spices, noodles, etc.

In the future Anita would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support two children. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a 1,800 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Lorna is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, de 49 años es una mujer emprendedora. Forjo su familia, junto a sus 6 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellas en su casa propia. Hace algunos años se separó de su esposo; desde entonces afrontó las responsabilidades de la familia. Esto le ayudó para convertirla en una mujer independiente. Es así que desde ese momento, hace 15 años; apertura un restaurante turístico; en una zona céntrica de su localidad. Donde brinda, todo tipo de alimentos a profesores, trabajadores de las entidades bancarias, abogados y doctores; que por motivo de trabajo radican en Pampas. Cuenta que recibe como mínimo 30 personas diarias. Pues ya tiene clientes fijos. Además, su secreto es preparar sus alimentos con los vegetales que ella misma siembra. Porque Anita, también tiene terrenos agrícolas, donde labra, en asociación con otra señora, ya que la mayor parte de su tiempo lo dedica a su restaurante, donde trabaja muy duro junto a sus hijas para salir adelante. Este es el crédito número 8 con MFP, en todo este tiempo demostró ser puntual y responsable sobre todo gusta de pertenecer a su asociación “los pétalos”,  que lo conforman personas solidarias y con espíritu emprendedor.
Ana, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los ricos platos de comida que vende.
texts.en:
49 year old Ana is a very enterprising woman. She forged her family of 6 children, of which only 2 live with her in her home. She separated from her husband some time ago. Since then, she has carried the family responsibilities. This helped to turn her into and independent woman. So it was that, at that time (15 years ago) she opened a tourist restaurant in the central area of her town. There she offers all types of food to professors, bank workers, lawyers, and doctors who are located in Pampas for work. She serves at least 30 people a day and she has regular customers. Her secret is that she prepares her dishes with vegetables that she grows herself as Anita also has some agricultural land where she works with another woman. However, most of her time is spent at the restaurant where she works very hard along with her daughters in order to be successful. This is her 8th loan from MFP. In this time, she has shown herself to be punctual and responsible and is well liked in her group "The Petals" which is comprised of united and entrepreneurially-spirited people. 
Ana will use the loan she is requesting to buy supplies to prepare the delicious dishes that she sells.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare the delicious dishes that she sells.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a fish business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her water refill station and pig business. Emma is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish for her business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her achieve her dream of sending her children to college. This is her second loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Pucallpa, el es una joven muy alegre, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no ha podido cursar la carrera profesional de Mecánica que tanto desea, pero sueña con poder hacerlo; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus hermanos y amigos, y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo Sudado de Sardina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Carlos puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de de venta de abarrotes, el dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y puede atender un promedio de 35 clientes; Carlos cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a que tiene buena clientela y a su buena atención. 
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, menestras, entre otros; de esta manera Carlos tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y acondicionado, así espera poder incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, para con ellos cumplir su gran sueño de poder construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 22 year old man. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Pucallpa. He is a cheerful, hardworking, and enthusiastic young man who has a great desire to succeed. Unfortunately, because he needed to work and pay the bills, he hasn't been able to pursue the mechanics course that he wants so much, but he dreams of being able to do so. In his spare time, he likes to play soccer with his brothers and friends and he sometimes make a delicious sardine stew to share with his family.
With much persistence and dedication, and on his own initiative, Carlos started his own business selling groceries. He works about 12 hours a day in his business and can serve an average of 35 customers. Carlos believes that his business is doing well because he has good customers and gives them good service. 
Carlos is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help they have offered him, he can buy merchandise for his business such as: rice, sugar, milk, oil, beans, and more In this way, Carlos will be able to have a better-supplied store and he hopes to increase his sales and his income so that he can realize his great dream of building his own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as: rice, sugar, milk, oil, beans, etc.

loans.name: Las Tres Marias Group

texts.es:
Saludos desde Peru! La Sra. Giovanna es integrante de la alcancía comunal “Las Tres Marias”, un grupo conformado por 5 socias que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.

Giovanna se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y pollo broaster los vende en las noches  desde hace 10 años , este negocio esta ubicado en su casa y cuenta con clientes fidelizados, Su sueño es un día tener un local propio, para así poder atender mejor a sus clientes.

Giovanna  ha solicitado el préstamo  para comprar insumos pollo, papas, huevo, para preparar salchipapas y pollo broaster.

giovanna  es separada y tiene 2 hijos. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación,Giovanna ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos que le permitido pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos. Giovanna está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Edaprospo y a Kiva.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! Giovanna is a member of the community bank "The Three Marias". This group is comprised of 5 members who run various types of business.
Giovanna sells salchipapas (a sausage and potato dish) and fried chicken. She sells these at night and has been doing this for 10 years. She runs this business from her home and has loyal customers. Her dream is to have her own business premises so that she could serve more customers. 
Giovanna has requested a loan to buy supplies such as chicken, potatoes, and eggs to prepare salchipapas and fried chicken. 
Giovanna is separated and has 2 children. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, Giovanna has achieved a better income that enables her to pay for her children to attend university. Giovanna is very happy with this loan and is grateful to Edaprospo and to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as chicken, potatoes, and eggs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also she earns additional income from her general store. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money for expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Ma. Enita

texts.en:
Ma. Enita is 38 years old, married, and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ma. Enita is borrowing 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell for her general store business.

Ma. Enita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 47 years old and married with 5 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Esperanza is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Esperanza has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns an additional income from her general store and buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 44 years old and married with seven children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Elvira has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Elvira aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza works hard to support her family. Flordeliza is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Flordeliza requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more clothing to sell.

Flordeliza has been in this business for four years now, and also earns an additional income from her videoke rentals and raising livestock businesses.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Lorna has been in this business for six years. Lorna earns additional income as a dealer of Avon products.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money for the future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory items to sell

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is 42 years old and married with two children.

Rebeca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Rebeca has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years, and she also earns an income from raising livestock.

Rebeca aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Hurmat

texts.ru: Хурмат женщина в возрасте 48 лет.  Она замужем имеет четверых детей.  Троих  сыновей  и одну  дочь.    Хурмат занимается откармливанием крупно рогатого скота и мелко рогатого скота у себя дома.     Младший сын помогает ей по  откармливанию  и купле  продажи скота .  Ее  муж  работает бригадиром в деканском  хозяйстве.     Старшие сыновья работают  разнорабочими.    Хурмат хочет развивать свой бизнес по выращиванию скота  потому что хороший доход у них от этой деятельности.    На полученный кредит она планирует  увеличить  количество коров чтобы  получит больше прибыли.    Хурмат   очень старается улучшить условия проживания и очень благодарна Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Hurmat is 48 and married with four children, three sons and one daughter. Hurmat fattens cows, sheep, and goats on her farm. Her younger son helps her fatten and trade livestock. Hurmat's husband is a supervisor on a dekhan farm, and her older sons are handymen.
Hurmat wants to grow her livestock business because she receives good profits from this business. She plans to spend her loan on buying more cows to increase her profits. Hurmat hopes to improve her living conditions and thanks Arvand for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell for her general store business.

Melba has been in this business for 10 years. Melba earns additional income from food vending and pig fattening.

Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family.

She has a used clothing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming mangoes. Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell in her business.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 61 years old and married with seven children.

Florida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Florida has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from food vending and raising pigs.

Florida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Hedidia

texts.en:
Hedidia has been in this business for 4 years. Hedidia earns additional income from her general store.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Hedidia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Diosdada has been in this business for eight years. Diosdada earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Diosdada has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for food production.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 52 years old and married.

Josefa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her grocery store.

Josefa has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the grocery store for seven years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Josefa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her general store business.

Gloria has been in this business for eight years. Gloria earns more income from buying and selling rice.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used seasonal clothes to resell

loans.name: Cupertino

texts.en: Using the abundant cow manure on his family farm, Cupertino will use his 8 cubic meter biodigester to reduce his cheese production costs while more effectively utilizing the waste he already has. His dairy farm is the primary source of income for his family and the biodigester will allow him to both displace non-renewable LP gas consumption and eliminate agrochemical fertilizer use on his farm. For him, the economic benefits are his primary concern but he is excited to concurrently reduce his impact on the environment. This Kiva loan represents 42% of the total cost of his system.

loans.use: To purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Beverly requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Beverly would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Herminigilda works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and running a general store. Herminigilda is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Herminigilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en:
Arminda is a 37-year-old married woman with five children. She has been involved in running a business since her parents passed away, because she has no one else to rely on. She took on the responsibility to earn money in order to survive, and she decided to open a kiosk. 
She has a kiosk in front of her home to supply the people in her village with basic goods. She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including flour, oil, soap and vegetables.
This is Arminda’s fourth loan from TRM. She has paid back her first three loans on time.  She is a very reliable client. 
Her kiosk is in a strategic place next to a private school and a main road; it helps her earn a better income.  She wants to make her kiosk into a big shop in the future

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, soap and vegetables.

loans.name: Diana Karolina

texts.es:
Diana tiene 25 años, es una persona trabajadora que aporta en su hogar para poder salir adelante con su familia. Diana vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en San Gabriel.

Diana y su esposo se dedican a la crianza de ganado para producción de leche y también a la crianza de cerdos para la venta, este negocio es el sustento económico para su familia, es por eso que tienen que estar en constante crecimiento para que su negocio de buenos ingresos, Diana solicita un crédito en Fodemi con el afán de comprar una vaca lechera y cuatro chanchos de raza para reproducción, esta inversión le ayudará a Diana a mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

Diana sueña en salir adelante con su negocio, incrementar su producción de leche con mas ganado, para que en un futuro sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diana is 25 years old. She is a hardworking person who supports her household so that her family can move forward. Diana lives with her husband and two children in San Gabriel. She and her husband raise dairy cattle for milk production, but they also raise pigs to sell. This business enables them to financially sustain their family. They desire for their business to experience constant growth so that it will generate good income.

Diana is requesting a loan from FODEMI so that she can buy a dairy cow and four pigs for breeding. This investment will help Diana improve her earnings and the quality of life for her children. She dreams of moving her business forward and increasing milk production with more cows. As a result, she will be able to provide a better quality of life for her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and balanced feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Belen

texts.es: Belén, de 57 años es una señora sencilla. Vive en compañía de Máximo, su esposo desde hace 30 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia. Ella es una mujer trabajadora. Se dedica a varias actividades, pues su mayor sueño es brindar una buena educación y calidad de vida a sus hijos. En las mañanas se dedica a la crianza de sus 6 vacas de las cuales lleva a pastar, para que le proporcione una buena leche. Pues realiza queso y lleva a vender ella misma a la capital del país. Donde obtiene un dinero adicional, pues es muy conocida y tiene clientes fijos. Además de dedicarse a la siembra de maíz, papa, alverja y quinua. Los que cuida gracias a su esposo, quien también le ayuda. Hace poco incursionaron en la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, durante este tiempo les fue muy bien en la venta de cerveza, por lo que siempre tienen que mover un capital de trabajo muy importante. Ahora esperan invertir más dinero y comprar al por mayor, ya que de esa manera obtienen menor precio de compra y más ganancia. Este es el crédito número 9 con MFP, en todo este tiempo demostró ser puntual y responsable sobre todo gusta de pertenecer a su asociación “los pétalos”,  que lo conforman personas solidarias y con espíritu emprendedor. Belén; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de bebidas por cajas para abastecer su negocio y mantener satisfechos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Belén, 57 years old, is a simple woman. She lives with Máximo, her husband of 30 years. They have three children, two of which live at home with them. Belén is a hardworking woman. She dedicates herself to several activities because her biggest dream is to offer her children a good education and good quality of life.  

In the mornings, Belén tends to her six cows and brings them to pasture so that they give good milk. She uses their milk to make cheeses, which she brings to the capital city to sell. Belén is a well-known vender and has many steady customers. With the help of her husband, she also grows corn, potatoes, peas, and quinoa. Not long ago, they began to also sell many kinds of drinks. It turned out that their sales of beer were very high, so now they want to invest more money in this and buy wholesale in order to get the best price per unit and earn more from their sales.

This is Belén's ninth loan with MFP. In all of her previous loans she has been punctual and responsible. Above all, she likes being a part of the association "los pétalos" (the petals), because it is comprised of supportive, enterprising members. Belén will invest the money requested to buy crates of beverages in order to supply her business and keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy crates of beverages to supply her business and keep her customers satisfied.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 68 years old and married with nine children.

Aida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Aida has borrowed and repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 33 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Aida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Gloria works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns an additional income from vending vegetables. 

Gloria is borrowing 15000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Grechen

texts.en:
Grechen is 23 years old and married with two children who are in school. Grechen works very hard to provide for them.

Grechen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, coffee, cream, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

In the future Grechen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nogrina

texts.en:
Nogrina is married with five children. Nogrina is 46 years old and four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nogrina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nogrina requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. Nogrina has been in this business for seven years. 

In the future, Nogrina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Norain

texts.en:
Norain is 42 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Norain has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

Norain is borrowing 12000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
This is Miguela, 53, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rhoan, a supervisor and a father to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Miguela operates an internet café business. There is more need now than before for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume and office documentation, as well as people who would just love to surf the net and social networks. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in profit every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed for her business. She expects a boost in income as she expands her business.  

Miguela dreams to have a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Grechen Joy

texts.en:
Grechen Joy is 22 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her store.

Grechen Joy has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Grechen Joy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
This time, for her seventh loan cycle, Diosdada is borrowing 11000 PHP to buy feed and medicine for her pigs. 

The food production business that she previously funded through Kiva partner NWTF continues and helps provide Diosdada and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Marieta works hard to support her family. She has a buying and selling egg business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dressed chicken (chicken that is ready for the oven) and from her general store. 

Marieta is borrowing 30000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional trays of eggs for her egg business to sell.

Marieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional trays of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Iluminada requested a 22000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Iluminada has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Iluminada would like to save money to expand her business. 

This is her second loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old and married with three children. Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 24000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in it.

Victoria has borrowed and paid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Victoria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad. NWTF is listing Rosalinda's business profile for another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad (cycle rickshaw/pedicab)

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 63 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Estelita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.

Estelita has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Amil

texts.en:
This is Amil, 25, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. He is married to Emma and a father to his children. He, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Amil runs an “ukay-ukay” business. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out” from a stack or heap of anything. In Amil’s case, he is selling used (but not yet worn out) clothes that are usually stacked up on a table or mat. Some special kinds are displayed in hangers. In the Philippines, especially in poor urban communities, many people resort to buying used clothes from “ukay-ukay” stalls. These are much cheaper compared with brand new clothes sold in malls. He earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) net sales every day. 

To help him expand the business, Amil is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to buy additional used quality clothing. Customers are attracted to buy from an “ukay-ukay” stall with lots of clothes to choose from. He plans to add more pants or jeans, as well as used bags and footwear. If he can roll over the profits from this loan, he can meet the customers’ demand. Through proper management of capital and profit, he can expand his business and boost its income.

Amil hopes to give his children a good and quality education through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and it is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional used quality clothing needed in his business.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 45 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. Isabelita is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Isabelita has a personal products sales business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like body lotion, pillows and other personal products.

Isabelita has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like body lotion, pillows and other personal products.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. Leonora is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Leonora requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory items to sell in her general store.

Leonora has been in this business for 16 years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and corn.

In the future, Leonora would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family. This is her third loan facilitated through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell in her general store

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase greater quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better business will be. More items available for sale will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Milagros hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ni Luh

texts.en:
Ni Luh lives in Melaya, West Bali.  She is married and has 2 children who are in school. Her husband is a farmer. She has a crop sales business.  She has been in this business for 3 years.  

Ni Luh is seeking a loan of 3 mill IDR from MUK to expand her business. With the loan, she will purchase more crops, such as banana, young coconut leaf, cacao etc.  She will sell to the market. With her earnings, she hopes to be able to pay school fees and fulfill her family daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase more crops, such as banana, young coconut leaf, cacao etc

loans.name: Lilanie

texts.en:
Lilanie is 56 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Lilanie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Lilanie has been raising livestock for 7 years and also earns additional income from fishing and a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 41 years old and married with seven children.

Jessica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, rice and other groceries.

Jessica has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from farming rice and a food vending business.

Jessica aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, rice and other groceries.

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Gantsetseg is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a small house in Songinohairhan province, Mongolia. Her husband Erdenebat is a driver. Her three children, Solongo, Delgersaihan and Anhiluun, are ages twelve, seven and three. They go to the second-level school and kindergarten. 

Mrs. Gantsetseg started transportation service business in 2009 with her husband. In future, she is planning to buy a new micro-bus. Her car is broken and due to this her business is stopped now. She is asking for a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase a car in order to continue her transportation-providing business.

loans.use: To purchase a car in order to continue her transportation business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan in her current revolving fund used to buy scrap materials. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Teresita dreams that her junk shop will last and continue to grow. She wants her children to finish studies and be able to have a comfortable life someday. She dreams of having her own car to drive someday. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a restaurant. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is 37 years old and married with eight children.

Valerie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Valerie has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from raising pigs and selling lumber.

Valerie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is 55 years old and married with four children.  

Melodia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Melodia requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Melodia has been farming rice for five years now, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melodia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita, She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Juanita hopes that her business will continue to grow and sustain her daily expenses. She wants to have more profit in order to help her family more.
